page.title: 15Hop Farming in Stonegate
page.content: The hop plant is planted under a frame work of timber and wire 16feet high.In the spring the hop starts to grow from the root stock which is left in the ground year after year.Each hop plant is called a hop hill.During April the hops are strung using a very long pole.Each hop hill has a screw peg to which the string is hooked,and special hooks at the top of the wire.Each hop hill has 4 strings.There are 1000 plants to 1 acre.When the hops are long enough they have to be trained to grow up the strings.This is done by winding two bines clockwise up a string.They will not grow any other way - it is an endless task that has to be done 3 or 4 times,until the bines reach the top of the wire.By this time the hops are starting to flower or form.
